pr_title: Identify backing indices for data streams

timeline.message: identify back indices with parent data stream

timeline.bodyText:
Can the return type be IndexAbstraction instead of DataStream (the data stream impl for IndexAbstraction)?
Currently DataStream doesn't have any methods that IndexAbstraction doesn't have and would be good to not rely on anything implementation specific.
timeline.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: I chose the return type of IndexAbstraction.DataStream for two reasons -- the parent data stream could never be an IndexAbstraction.Index or IndexAbstraction.Alias and when implementing data stream rollover in the next PR, I added a getDataStream method to IndexAbstraction.DataStream which is convenient to call from getParentDataStream without casting.
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: Ok, that makes sense. I just prefer that other code isn't going to rely on data stream specific methods (like is today with the alias impl). Otherwise the abstraction is going to be leaky.
replies.author: martijnvg

timeline.bodyText:
Can we reuse the IndexAbstraction.DataStream created here in the logic below here that adds data streams to the indices lookup? I think it would nice that if a data stream is lookup directly or via a backing index that the same instance is returned.
I think we can do this if we add the data streams to the indicesLookup map before we add the indices to the indicesLookup map?
timeline.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: @martijnvg, I agree that would be nice. Adding data streams to indicesLookup before indices means that name conflicts will be reported as Index [foo] conflicts with existing data stream [foo]... rather than Data stream [foo] conflicts with existing index [foo].... If you are ok with that, I'll make the change.
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText:
I think that is ok.
Maybe rename the exception to: index [foo] and data stream [foo] have the same name
or something like that, so the name conflict is bad regardless which one was added first.
replies.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: Actually, for consistency and simplicity, I should probably add data streams to the duplicate name check for aliases and indices that occurs before the call to buildIndicesLookup.
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText:
I should probably add data streams to the duplicate name check for aliases and indices that occurs before the call to buildIndicesLookup.

👍
replies.author: martijnvg

replies.bodyText: I think it is a requirement that we reuse the same instances, since equals is not overridden.
replies.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText:
Can we add:
assert parent.getIndices().contains(indexMetadata.getIndex())

that would  validate that uuid and name from data-stream indices is the same as the index we are looking at.
